main event: An observer reported seeing three flying saucers with 13 beings each having one eye and a brilliant white color over Lewisburg, Pennsylvania on January 8, 1966.
interesting points: The observer described the object as round or elliptical with a highly reflective metallic surface,It emitted a bright white light that occasionally changed colors to greenish or bluish hues,The object was estimated to be 50-75 feet in diameter and remained stationary for several minutes before suddenly accelerating,The object executed sharp turns and maneuvers and then climbed at a steep angle before disappearing,The observer was familiar with local aircraft and weather phenomena, leading them to conclude the object was not conventional.
witness description: The observer was a long-time resident familiar with local aircraft and weather phenomena.
